intro: Waltheria maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like bracts that surround its showy yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and salt marshes. Its unique morphology and salt tolerance make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
